data.title: Namma Metro: Latest News, Videos and Photos of Namma Metro
data.meta_description: namma metro News: Latest and Breaking News on namma metro. Explore namma metro profile at Times of India for photos, videos and latest news of namma metro. Also find news, photos and videos on namma metro
data.text:
Bengaluru's namma metro ridership jumps to record 9.2 lakh on Independence Day eve

TNN / Aug 16, 2024, 00:25 (IST)

namma metro in Bengaluru recorded a significant ridership of nearly 9.2 lakh on August 14. The Purple Line saw over 4.4 lakh passengers, while the Green Line had more than 3 lakh commuters. The Majestic interchange station was used by over 1.7 lakh people. Increased patronage, driven by a long weekend and the Lalbagh flower show, generated Rs 2.

Rain gods help Bengaluru's namma metro clock highest ridership of 8.3 lakh

TNN / Aug 08, 2024, 16:46 (IST)

Bengaluru's namma metro saw a historic high in ridership with 8.3 lakh passengers on August 6, following a strong turnout the previous day. Increased trains on peak routes and rain-induced travel preferences contributed. Issues such as overcrowding and safety measures like platform screen doors were highlighted by commuters.

Bengaluru: Man dies after jumping in front of Metro train, services hit for 3 hours

TNN / Aug 05, 2024, 14:42 (IST)

namma metro services on the Green Line in Bengaluru were disrupted after a 57-year-old passenger, Naveen Kumar Arora, jumped in front of an approaching train at Doddakallasandra station. The incident halted services from Yelachenahalli to Silk Institute for nearly three hours. The disruption affected many passengers, prompting evacuations and train diversions. Services resumed after police clearance.

Actor Aparna Vastarey, voice behind namma metro announcements, dies

TNN / Jul 12, 2024, 08:14 (IST)

Aparna Vastarey, a versatile personality known for her work as a radio anchor, television presenter, and actress, has passed away at the age of 57. She leaves behind a legacy in the entertainment industry, having started her career in the 1980s.

Bengaluru metro travel turns into push & shove affair

TNN / Jul 06, 2024, 04:20 (IST)

namma metro faces challenges with overcrowded coaches on the Purple Line during peak hours. Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation is making adjustments by adding more trains and changing schedules to meet the increasing demand from passengers.

Bengaluru: Trees grown to make up for Metro lines now facing axe

TNN / Jun 29, 2024, 04:54 (IST)

In the midst of BMRCL's phase 3 namma metro project, concerns raised by activist Dattatraya T Devare underscore the importance of environmental impact assessments and compliance with legal regulations to mitigate the impact of tree removal on green cover in Bengaluru.

Bengaluru: namma metro Purple Line services restored after fallen tree branch disruption

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Jun 03, 2024, 10:10 (IST)

Metro services on the Purple Line in Bengaluru have resumed after disruptions caused by strong winds and heavy rain. The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited has restored normal service following a tree branch falling on the tracks. The India Meteorological Department forecasts light rainfall and the advancement of the Southwest Monsoon in Karnataka.

Slow moving trains on Purple Line irks namma metro passengers

TNN / Feb 20, 2024, 12:01 (IST)

Passengers at Majestic interchange station faced inconvenience and long wait times due to slow moving trains caused by technical snags in the signaling system between Baiyappanahalli and Garudacharpalya metro stations. BMRCL officials worked to fix the problem and additional trains were operated to clear the rush.

NLSIU student jumps in front of Metro train, dies

TNN / Mar 22, 2024, 07:10 (IST)

NLSIU student Dhruv Jatin Thakkar's suicide at Attiguppe station prompted demands for platform screen doors on namma metro. The incident led to disruptions on the Purple Line, highlighting the need for enhanced safety measures in the metro system.

Man jumps in front of namma metro train, dies; Bengaluru's Purple Line services hit

TNN / Mar 21, 2024, 15:46 (IST)

namma metro Purple Line disrupted as a person commits suicide at Attiguppe. Incident at 2:10 pm. Services suspended from Magadi Road to Challaghatta. Passengers call for platform screen doors to prevent such incidents.

E-autos driven by women launched at two metro stations in Bengaluru

TNN / Mar 01, 2024, 20:12 (IST)

A new fleet of electric-autos has been launched at Yelachenahalli and Indiranagar Metro stations in a collaboration between Alstom and WRI India. These e-autos, driven by women, aim to improve last-mile sustainable connectivity and empower women. Commuters can conveniently book these autos using the Metro Ride mobile app for travel within a 4 km radius of the metro stations. The services were introduced on Wednesday.
